medium: Steel, wood, bronze with polychrome patina and baked enamel
creditline: Gift of Hans Mautner, Class of 1959

makers.displaydate: 1939–1995; born Pittsfield, MA; died New York, NY; active New Haven, CT; Paris, France; and New York, NY
makers.displaymaker: Nancy Graves, 1939–1995; born Pittsfield, MA; died New York, NY; active New Haven, CT; Paris, France; and New York, NY

texts.textentryhtml: The 1969 landing of astronauts on the surface of the moon sparked a golden era of space exploration that became a defining influence for many artists, including Graves. Eclipse speaks to the artist’s fascination with moonscapes and celestial bodies in an oblique yet humorous way—the title is drawn from the cast-iron object situated at the base, a vintage windmill weight in the shape of a crescent moon on which the model name, Eclipse, is emblazoned in bold letters. Graves juxtaposed and merged painting and sculpture, nature and the manmade, while generating unexpected and poetic associations with the notion of an eclipse.
Hans Mautner, London, United Kingdom, gift; to Princeton University Art Museum, 2004.
